Mutate and transmutate a data.frame

mutate.Rd

Mutate and transmutate a data.frame.

Usage

# mutate_(df, ...)
# transmutate_(df, ...)

Details

mutate_ and transmutate_ execute expressions non-grouped. If the m61r object is in a grouped state (via $group_by()), that grouping state is ignored by the primitive functions, ensuring Base R speed for vectorised operations.

Arguments

df

data.frame

...

formula used for mutating/transmutating the data.frame

Value

The functions return a data frame. The output has the following properties:

  • For function mutate_(), output includes all df columns. In addition, new columns are created according to argument ... and placed after the others.

  • For function transmutate_(), output includes only columns created according to argument ... and placed after the others.

Examples

tmp <- mutate_(CO2,z=~conc/uptake)
head(tmp)
#>   Plant   Type  Treatment conc uptake         z
#> 1   Qn1 Quebec nonchilled   95   16.0  5.937500
#> 2   Qn1 Quebec nonchilled  175   30.4  5.756579
#> 3   Qn1 Quebec nonchilled  250   34.8  7.183908
#> 4   Qn1 Quebec nonchilled  350   37.2  9.408602
#> 5   Qn1 Quebec nonchilled  500   35.3 14.164306
#> 6   Qn1 Quebec nonchilled  675   39.2 17.219388

# Return an warning: expression mean(uptake) get a result with 'nrow' different from 'df'
# tmp <- mutate_(CO2,mean=~mean(uptake))

tmp <- mutate_(CO2,z1=~uptake/conc,y=~conc/100)
head(tmp)
#>   Plant   Type  Treatment conc uptake         z1    y
#> 1   Qn1 Quebec nonchilled   95   16.0 0.16842105 0.95
#> 2   Qn1 Quebec nonchilled  175   30.4 0.17371429 1.75
#> 3   Qn1 Quebec nonchilled  250   34.8 0.13920000 2.50
#> 4   Qn1 Quebec nonchilled  350   37.2 0.10628571 3.50
#> 5   Qn1 Quebec nonchilled  500   35.3 0.07060000 5.00
#> 6   Qn1 Quebec nonchilled  675   39.2 0.05807407 6.75

tmp <- transmutate_(CO2,z2=~uptake/conc,y2=~conc/100)
head(tmp)
#>           z2   y2
#> 1 0.16842105 0.95
#> 2 0.17371429 1.75
#> 3 0.13920000 2.50
#> 4 0.10628571 3.50
#> 5 0.07060000 5.00
#> 6 0.05807407 6.75

# with m61r class
co2 <- m61r(df=CO2)

co2$mutate(z=~conc/uptake)
co2
#>    Plant        Type  Treatment conc uptake         z

co2$transmutate(z2=~uptake/conc,y2=~conc/100)
